IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: STUDENTS ARE THE FOCUS AT MCDANIEL AND PROVIDING THE IDEAL LEARNING ENVIRONMENT IS OUR GOAL. CENTERED IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AND SCIENCES, A MCDANIEL EDUCATION TEACHES YOU TO THINK AND ACT CRITICALLY, CREATIVELY, AND HUMANELY. COMBINED WITH LEADERSHIP AND KNOWLEDGE IN YOUR FIELD, THESE ARE THE SKILLS THAT STUDENTS NEED TO SURMOUNT THE CHALLENGES OF THEIR FUTURE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: STUDENTS ARE THE FOCUS AT MCDANIEL, AND PROVIDING THE IDEAL LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR THE STUDENT IS OUR GOAL. CENTERED IN LIBERAL ARTS AND SCIENCES, A MCDANIEL EDUCATION TEACHES YOU TO THINK AND ACT CRITICALLY, CREATIVELY, AND HUMANELY. COMBINED WITH LEADERSHIP AND KNOWLEDGE IN YOUR FIELD, THESE ARE THE SKILLS THAT STUDENTS NEED TO SURMOUNT THE CHALLENGES OF THEIR FUTURE.
IRS990.Description: UNDERGRADUATE PROGRAM OF STUDY - 1,585 FULL TIME STUDENT EQUIVALENCY.MCDANIEL COLLEGE HAS A LONG HISTORY AS A SMALL PRIVATE COLLEGE OF THE LIBERAL ARTS. MCDANIEL OFFERS COURSES OF STUDY IN MORE THAN 60 AREAS, INCLUDING PRE-PROFESSIONAL PROGRAMS, TEACHING CERTIFICATION, AND OFF-CAMPUS PROGRAMS. STUDENTS MAY PURSUE TRADITIONAL, DUAL, OR DOUBLE MAJORS, OR DESIGN THEIR OWN COURSE OF STUDY. THE AVERAGE CLASS SIZE IS 15.2 STUDENTS; THE STUDENT-FACULTY RATIO IS 12-1, MCDANIEL HAS 105 FULL-TIME FACULTY; 91.1 PERCENT HOLD DOCTORATE DEGREES IN THEIR DISCIPLINES. ALL COURSES AND LABORATORIES ARE TAUGHT BY REGULAR FACULTY MEMBERS, NOT TEACHING ASSISTANTS. THE COLLEGE OFFERS COUNTLESS OPPORTUNITIES FOR OFF-CAMPUS STUDY BOTH WITHIN THE UNITED STATES AND OVERSEAS. AMONG THEM: STUDY IN BUDAPEST, HUNGARY THROUGH AN AGREEMENT WITH COLLEGE INTERNATIONAL WHICH FOLLOWS MCDANIEL'S CURRICULUM.MCDANIEL IS ACCREDITED BY THE COMMISSION ON HIGHER EDUCATION OF THE MIDDLE STATES ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS.

Activity2.Description: AUXILARY SERVICES: DINING HALL SERVICES FOR 1,251 STUDENTS AND RESIDENCE HALL SERVICES FOR 1,271 STUDENTS.RESIDENCE HALL - AT MCDANIEL FIRST, SECOND AND THIRD YEAR STUDENTS ALL LIVE ON CAMPUS. IN FACT, ALL STUDENTS ARE GUARANTEED HOUSING FOR ALL FOUR YEARS. EXCEPTIONS TO THE RESIDENCY REQUIREMENTS ARE MADE FOR THOSE WHO LIVE NEARBY WITH THEIR PARENTS, ARE MARRIED, OR ARE OVER AGE 24 OR PART TIME.YOU'LL FIND A RANGE OF OPTIONS, INCLUDING CLASSIC DORM STYLE ARRANGEMENTS AND APARTMENT SUITES, STAFFED BY FRIENDLY AND CAPABLE RESIDENT ASSISTANTS, WHO ARE SUPERVISED BY PROFESSIONAL STAFF. ALL RESIDENCES ARE WIRED FOR CABLE, TELEPHONE AND THE INTERNET.DINING HALL - AT MCDANIEL, STUDENTS HAVE A WIDE RANGE OF DINING CHOICES, CHOOSEN FROM A VARIETY OF MEAL PLANS DESIGNED FOR DORM, APARTMENT, OR COMMUTER STUDENT LIVING. ALL DINING LOCATIONS ARE WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE AND OFFER EXTENSIVE HOURS.

Activity3.Description: GRADUATE PROGRAM OF STUDY - FULL TIME STUDENT EQUIVALENCY 888.THE MISSION OF GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL STUDIES IS TO PREPARE CULTURALLY COMPETENT PROFESSIONALS COMMITTED TO LEADERSHIP IN THEIR FIELD. STUDENTS ARE PLACED IN THE CENTER OF A COMMUNITY RICH IN THE LIBERAL ARTS TRADITION. AN EMPHASIS ON THE FOUNDATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND CRITICAL DECISION MAKING BASED ON CURRENT RESEARCH, THEORY AND PRACTICE ARE CENTRAL TO THE VARIOUS PROGRAMS.TWO GRADUATE DEGREES ARE GRANTED BY MCDANIEL COLLEGE: THE MASTER OF LIBERAL ARTS: AND THE MASTER OF SCIENCE. MCDANIEL COLLEGE IS ACCREDITED BY THE COMMISSION ON HIGHER EDUCATION OF THE MIDDLE STATES ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS, ALSO ACCREDITED BY: AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY, COUNCIL ON SOCIAL WORK EDUCATION, NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR ACCREDITATION OF TEACHER EDUCATION AND MARYLAND STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.MCDANIEL COLLEGE GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL STUDIES DOES MORE THAN PREPARE TEACHERS, ADMINISTRATORS, COUNSELORS, AND A HOST OF EDUCATIONAL SPECIALISTS. AT MCDANIEL, YOU WILL FIND PROFESSIONAL PROGRAMS IN EXERCISE SCIENCE, GERONTOLOGY, HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND LEADERSHIP IN GLOBAL ENTERPRISE.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PAID MEMBERSHIP DUES OF $81,646 TO THE MARYLAND INDEPENDENT COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES ASSOCIATION (MICUA), WHICH ENGAGES IN LOBBYING ACTIVITY. MICUA SET ASIDE 16% OF THE DUES PAID TO ENGAGE IN NONDEDUCTIBLE LOBBYING AND POLITICAL EXPENDITURES. ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE HAS REPORTED AN AMOUNT EQUAL TO 16% OF MEMBERSHIP DUES PAID ON LINE 1I.

OtherSecurities.Description: INVESTMENT IN VENTURE LEADING & LEASING III
INVESTMENT IN VENTURE LEADING & LEASING IV

OtherLiabilities.Description: REFUNDABLE ADVANCES FROM THE U.S. GOVERNMENT

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: IN THE EVENT THE COLLEGE RECEIVES DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS, DETERMINATION OF THE NET ASSET CLASSIFICATION FOR THE CORPUS AND RETURN ON INVESTMENTS IS BASED ON THE DONOR'S INTENTIONS. IN THE EVENT THE COLLEGE'S BOARD DETERMINES CERTAIN NON-DONOR FUNDS AS BOARD DESIGNATED, THOSE RESPECTIVE FUNDS ARE CLASSIFIED AS UNRESTRICTED AND THE RETURN ON THOSE FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT THE GENERAL PROGRAM EXPENSES OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FIN 48 DISCLOSURE FROM FINANACIAL STATEMENT: ASC 740, Income Taxes (ASC 740), prescribes a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. For those benefits to be recognized, a tax position must be more-likely-than-not to be sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. The amount recognized is measured as the largest amount of benefit that is greater than 50 percent likely of being realized upon ulimate settlement. The College adopted the provisions of ASC 740 during the year ended June 30, 2008. The adoption did not have a material impact on the College's consolidated financial statements.

PART XII, LINE 2A: NET UNREALIZED GAIN ON INVESTMENTS AS A RESULT OF MARKET CHANGE FOR FISCAL YEAR 2010. THE INCREASE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLLEGE ENDOWMENT MARKET CHANGE DURING FISCAL 2010. PART XII, LINE 4B AND PART XIII, LINE 4B: SCHOLARSHIP AND FINANCIAL AID IS CONSIDERED FINANCIAL RESOURCE USED TO DISCOUNT THE STUDENTS' FINANCIAL OBLIGATION. GENERALLY SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS DIVIDED INTO TWO CATEGORIES: NON-NEED-BASED AND NEED-BASED. PER THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, SCHOLARSHIP AND FINANCIAL AID IS RECORDED AS A DISCOUNT TO GROSS TUITION AND FEES. PER THE TAX RETURN, SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS RECORDED ON PART IX, LINE 3.

IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: MCDANIEL RECEIVES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR FINANCIAL AID FROM THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT AS WELL AS THE STATE OF MARYLAND. THE FUNDS THAT ARE RECEIVED ARE EARMARKED BY THE GOVERNMENT AGENCY FOR CERTAIN STUDENTS AND THE COLLEGE HAS NO DECISION MAKING POWER OVER THE FUNDS.

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: MCDANIEL RECEIVED $140,210 IN REVENUE FOR PREPARATORY PROGRAM (PRE MED COURSES). COURSES WERE TAUGHT UNDER THE MCDANIEL CURRICULUM.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: STD RESIDENT FAC, ACADEMIC BUILDING AND PROVIDE FUNDS TO REFUND 1997 ISSUE.
STD RESIDENT FAC, NEW FITNESS CTR, AND CONSTRUCTION OF GROUNDS DEPT FACILITY

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is posted to the Board of Directors' trustee website for review. The Form 990 is part of the February 5, 2011 board meeting agenda. The Form 990 is accepted at this meeting prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MCDANIEL COLLEGE HAS ALL TRUSTEES, KEY EMPLOYEES, AND OFFICERS COMPLETE AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT FOR CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. TAXPAYER HAS 100% PARTICIPATION WITH THE COMPLETION OF THE STATEMENT. A LIST IS COMPILED, REVIEWED AND ON FILE WITH THE FINANCE AND PRESIDENT'S OFFICE. CONTRACTS AND VENDORS ARE PERIODICALLY REVIEWED AND BIDS ARE OBTAINED AND REVIEWED WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST AWARENESS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT (CE0) AND PRESIDENT'S COUNCIL (VPS/PROVOST) COMPENSATION PACKAGES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. A COMPARISON OF COMPENSATION IS MADE TO THE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PERSONNEL ASSOCIATION'S (CUPA) ADMINISTRATIVE COMPENSATION SURVEY. PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS ARE ALSO REVIEWED. A RECOMMENDATION IS MADE TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL OF COMPENSATION PACKAGES. OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT'S COUNCIL AND COMPARISONS ARE MADE TO OTHER COLLEGES' COMPARABLE POSITIONS USING CUPA'S ANNUAL SURVEY DATA ALSO LOCAL MARKETS ARE SURVEYED PERIODICALLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE BY REQUEST AT THE FOLLOWING OFFICES: FINANCIAL SERVICES, PRESIDENT'S, OR DEVELOPMENT. CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE BY REQUEST. FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE BY REQUEST TO THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE OR CAN BE OBTAINED ONLINE AT GUIDESTAR.ORG.
THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WERE AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM ON A CONSOLIDATED BASIS.
THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: SCHEDULE D, PARTS XI, XII, AND XIV:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S AMOUNTS PER THE RETURN HAVE BEEN RECONCILED TO THE CONSOLIDATING SCHEDULES OF THE CONSOLIDATED AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

The college advertisements cover the state of Maryland, the primary segment of our general community. Under IRS procedures 75-50, exception 4.03 - 2 (b), the balance of our student body comes from a large geographical area. They are contacted through visits to high schools by admissions counselors with student publications.

NameOfRelatedOrg.BusinessNameLine1: BILLY MAC'S INC CO MCDANIEL COLLEGE
